Blog.post: urlLink A man wanted to kick my ass for taking pictures of this bus that is up on blocks. urlLink
urlLink Rural south central KS. Starting on the left and going right you are looking east to south in the center of the pic, then ending on the right side looking southwest. urlLink
urlLink trogdor. burning it up! urlLink
urlLink Beyond The Embrace urlLink
urlLink I was discussing chocolate pancakes with Foogoo on irc so I thought I might take a picture of them for him. urlLink

urlLink I take it Alice Cooper was singing about this place. urlLink

urlLink Converted to black and white. This is the mushroom rock on the north side of the park. urlLink
urlLink Mushroom Rock on the south side of the park. People carve their names in the rocks with dates and things. The oldest date I found was from 1887. urlLink
urlLink same guy, different angle urlLink
urlLink Found him in the middle of the road that boarders the Smoky Hill Bombing Range. urlLink

urlLink Coronado on his search for the Seven cities of gold turned around on this Butte in central Kansas. Panoramic picture is like this. the right side of the image is south, the center of the image is east, and the left side is north. urlLink
urlLink Stealth Bomber over State Highway 4 in Central Kansas, 6-17-04. urlLink

urlLink A 300 plus mile road trip through Kansas gives you lots of things to look at. However this was not expected. We saw two stealth bombers flying around over the Lyons KS area today. Why? I don't know why. They are stationed over in MO. Kansas has an old Bombing range not to far from my location when I shot these. Maybe they were out practicing or something. It would suck to have one of these fly up on you if your Taliban or something. BOOM! urlLink

Yo! Today on the way to work was interesting. It was pouring rain so hard that I couldn't the car in front of me. I was thinking 'Pile up on west Kellogg' but thankfuly that didn't happen. I know that I was in control of my car, but everyone else out there is a different story. I got soaked in the parking lot walking in to work. The next crew to walk in after the 6:30 crew (mine) was dry as could be. Puts a new meaning to the saying "rain on your parade". But whatever. After work I am going to The Yard hardware store with Justin to check out some stuff. He is building some customer speaker boxes for his Nissan Z, and I know they have a million things that he might be interested in looking at. I think we might be rolling out to Home Depot to look into some wood as well. I plan on shooting a few pictures in either location. Should be interesting. My friend and fellow www.5ksummer.com comrad, MDX told me that he got kicked out of the Gap for shooting pictures in there. I went there this past weekend took one picture. As soon as the shutter was done, this dude came up and was real interested in me as a client offering me help with this and help with that. I only took that one picture, but I wonder what would have happened if I took more. Jess was with me so I didn't want to push the issue and possibly get kicked out. She is not hip with me doing that sort of thing. Really though, I cannot blame her. I spoke with Catherine from Syracuse last night on the net. It had been a while and it was good to chit chat. For those of you who don't know her it is Jessica's brother, Mark's girlfriend. She is a phototograjunkie like me. She was looking for a free place on the net to pose thousands of pictures. Anyone have any ideas on that, just let me know. This turkey dinner is good.

urlLink The normal things we all take for granted everyday make the best images. I drive past this fence everyday and never noticed its textures until I snapped this off. The shading, repetition, and contrast in this fence caught me off guard being that it was 'just a fence'. Captured on flim it turned into a world of texture. Anyhow I like this picture. Go outside take a few and enjoy. urlLink

urlLink There is this old house west of town and this spoon was inside. I took many photos og that house. It was a blast walking around in an old rotting house. the things you find in there are strange. urlLink
urlLink this is me in infrared light. urlLink
urlLink Jess got my old car out of storage for me. My birthday gift. She is so sweet for doign that. urlLink

urlLink I really like rainy days, and today is a nice one. I never really feel like shooting pictures on these days so I am taking this one off. It better not rain for the next few days because I plan on taking loads of pictures. urlLink

Today on my way to work the cloud were perfect for shooting. So I filled my obligations and shot away. Clocked in at 06:29 when the day starts at 06:30 so i just made it in. This afternoon the clouds were all fluffy so I shot some more on a lenghthy drive home. I was stuck on the concept of light poles and sharp angles. Took a few good ones. Today was a creative day. While at work I joked around with my pal Anthony all day and shot apicture of his ipod. The coolest picture was the bug parts and hair and crumbs from the inside of the break room fridge however.
urlLink The KS badlands just south of Castle Rock are 100 times more impressive than Cast Rock. urlLink
urlLink comic book super villan! urlLink
urlLink The one in St. Louis is to far east in my opinion. urlLink
urlLink Not quite what dad was looking for in Wyoming, but close enough, right here in Kansas. Cool thing is I found what I was looking for. :) urlLink
urlLink Looking up standing at the bottom of the arch at monument rocks. urlLink
urlLink I got it to work. Only took about a year. urlLink
